final_answer.explanation: Franklin Pierce served as a senator from New Hampshire until his resignation on February 28, 1842. Following his resignation, Leonard Wilcox was appointed to fill the vacancy on March 1, 1842. During the 27th Congress, the two senators from New Hampshire were Franklin Pierce and Leonard Wilcox. Since Pierce resigned before Wilcox was appointed, Wilcox became the only senator from New Hampshire after that date. Therefore, Wilcox is considered the more senior senator by default, as he was the only senator representing New Hampshire after Pierce's departure.
final_answer.answer: Leonard Wilcox is the more senior senator from New Hampshire.

During the 27th Congress, Franklin Pierce was a senator from New Hampshire. The two senators from New Hampshire at that time were:

2. Leonard Wilcox (Democrat) - He was appointed on March 1, 1842, after Pierce's resignation.

Since Franklin Pierce resigned before Leonard Wilcox was appointed, Wilcox became the more senior senator from New Hampshire during the 27th Congress.
